{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3325476,"name":"Gal","username":"GalDotan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/galdotan/{size}/201749_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T08:15:29.119Z","cooked":"

I saw an interesting concept (initially saw it on 3339 BumbleB) of putting the limelight on a turret for localization so the limelight always tracks the closest tag. I can think in my head how the logic of testing what is the closest tag and following it is just like a regular turret, but the trick is that the yaw offset of the limelight changes with the angle of the turret. knowing this angle is easy (encoder on the turret) but how do you change the angle in the limelight UI? Can you do it through software?

Another thing I can think of doing to localization on the roborio, but it sounds like it would take a lot of resources.

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T08:37:00.420Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":43,"reads":527,"readers_count":526,"score":325.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457524,"topic_slug":"limelight-on-a-turrent","display_username":"Gal","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":2,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60986,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"5951 Software and electrical lead"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-on-a-turrent/457524/1","custom_user_title":"5951 Software and electrical lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3325537,"name":"Eric (319)","username":"EKM_319","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/ekm_319/{size}/230932_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T13:26:33.918Z","cooked":"

I’ve been wondering this as well.

Having not tried it… i would assume you’d update the appropriate ‘camerapose_robotspace’ NT entry periodically.

I’m not sure how/if this would really affect performance. But seems like a neat experiment.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T13:26:33.918Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":457,"readers_count":456,"score":91.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":457524,"topic_slug":"limelight-on-a-turrent","display_username":"Eric (319)","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23786,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Awaiting our Robot Overlords since 2013"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-on-a-turrent/457524/2","custom_user_title":"Awaiting our Robot Overlords since 2013","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3325601,"name":"Owen Busler","username":"Owen_Busler","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/owen_busler/{size}/7684_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T14:53:07.924Z","cooked":"

When messing around with april tag localization last summer, we briefly looked into this. Our “solution” was to set the robotToCam transformation to translation(0,0,0) and rotation(0,0,0) in our photon pose estimator. Then we took the estimated pose and did our own transformation each loop based off the angle the limelight was facing.

We didnt test accuracy at all but it was enough to run some small little paths where we drove out of FOV of the tags, rotated the camera to face the tags again, and continued the path.

GalDotan:

Another thing I can think of doing to localization on the roborio, but it sounds like it would take a lot of resources.

if you take the apriltag 3d x, y output that gives forward and horizontal distance, its actually not resource intensive at all, we do it in our codebase, its just some really simple math(well mostly simple)

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":13,"updated_at":"2024-03-06T15:49:51.098Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":336,"readers_count":335,"score":67.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":457524,"topic_slug":"limelight-on-a-turrent","display_username":"Kade Rabe","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":52484,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team 3082 - Programmer/Driver"},"post_url":"/t/limelight-on-a-turrent/457524/4","custom_user_title":"Team 3082 - Programmer/Driver","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3325856,"name":"Niran Schneller","username":"NiranSchneller","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/niranschneller/{size}/212122_2.png","created_at":"2024-03-06T17:38:30.966Z","cooked":"

Hey ,
I’ll briefly explain how we chose to do this.

First of all, @Owen_Busler 's solution is pretty close to what we have done, just a bit different.

What we did is set the Limelight location on the robot (Camera in Robot space) as (0,0,Z) in terms of Translation (X and Y are both 0), and (0,Roll,Pitch) in terms of Rotation (Yaw is zero). This means that when the Limelight rotates, the robot position wouldn’t change because the software thinks that the Limelight’s location is at the robot’s center. Then, the rest is just vector manipulation to get the location of the robot’s center.

We also tried using the “camerapose_robotspace” NT Entry (as @EKM_319 suggested), but couldn’t get it to work.

Hope this helps.

With photonvision, you configure the robotToCamera offset Transform3d in code. You might consider opting for it if you have too many difficulties with Limelight. It would be tough mid season, but worth a shot if you really couldn’t get Limelight working for some reason.

Wait… HOLD UP. If I were you, just put 0s in for the transformation in the Limelight UI, then apply a dynamic Transform3d on the Pose3d coming from Limelight, assuming it is a Pose3d. That should work, I don’t know why I didn’t think of that first.
